_decoded_content.title: Format extractor and loader docs consistently
_decoded_content.description:
The pages linked from https://meltano.com/plugins/extractors/ and https://meltano.com/plugins/loaders/ are not currently formatted consistently and often prioritize the UI over the CLI, making it harder than it needs to be to find out how to add one to your project and configure it.

- [x] Extractors
  - [x] Comma Separated Values (CSV): https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1925
  - [x] Facebook Ads: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1926
  - [x] Fastly: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1927
  - [x] GitLab: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1924
  - [x] Google Ads: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1928
  - [x] Google Analytics: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1929
  - [x] Marketo: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1931
  - [x] MongoDB: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1932
  - [x] Salesforce: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1933
  - [x] Shopify: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1934
  - [x] Spreadsheets Anywhere: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1935
  - [x] Stripe: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1936
  - [x] Zendesk: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1937
- [x] Loaders
  - [x] Comma Separated Values (CSV): https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1922
  - [x] JSON Lines (JSONL): https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1923
  - [x] PostgreSQL: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1920
  - [x] SQLite: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1921

_decoded_content.title: Mention Meltano UI on homepage and in new doc
_decoded_content.description: The CLI will remain the primary interface, but the UI continues to improve in terms of project, plugin, and pipeline management (https://gitlab.com/groups/meltano/-/epics/78).

_decoded_content.title: Add "Contributing" section to Introduction doc
_decoded_content.description: Let's make it abundantly clear that we welcome contributions to Meltano itself, the docs, known plugins, and specific taps and targets.

_decoded_content.title: Add ".meltano directory" section to The Meltano Project doc
_decoded_content.description: Let's document what this directory is used for, paths users may want to know for debugging purposes, and the fact that it's environment-specific.

_decoded_content.title: Add ".env" section to The Meltano Project doc
_decoded_content.description: Let's document what this file is used for, and link to https://12factor.net/config and/or https://github.com/theskumar/python-dotenv#usages.

_decoded_content.title: Add "System database" section to The Meltano Project doc
_decoded_content.description: We need a better place to link to than https://meltano.com/docs/settings.html#database-uri or https://meltano.com/docs/production.html#storing-metadata.

_decoded_content.title: Add "meltano.yml" section to The Meltano Project doc
_decoded_content.description:
Document what `meltano.yml` is used for and that it can be added manually.

Later, we can reference the JSON Schema (https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2211) and the Reference doc (https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2178).

_decoded_content.title: Add "Using a custom fork of a plugin" section to Plugin Management doc
_decoded_content.description:
Let's document that users can change the `pip_url` and run `meltano install <type> <plugin>`.

They'll need to be aware of https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2224, though.

_decoded_content.title: Add "Removing plugins from your project" section to Plugin Management doc
_decoded_content.description: Let's make it explicit that removing the entry from `meltano.yml` is usually sufficient, but that traces will remain in `.meltano` and the system database.

_decoded_content.title: Add "Known and custom plugins" section to Plugins doc
_decoded_content.description: We need a better place to link "known to Meltano" to than https://meltano.com/docs/contributor-guide.html#known-plugins.

_decoded_content.title: Add "Overriding Singer stream schema" section to Data Integration (EL) doc
_decoded_content.description: Guide for https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#schema-extra, like we have https://meltano.com/docs/integration.html#selecting-entities-and-attributes-for-extraction for https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#select-extra.

_decoded_content.title: Add "Setting Singer stream metadata" section to Data Integration (EL) doc
_decoded_content.description: Guide for https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#metadata-extra, like we have https://meltano.com/docs/integration.html#selecting-entities-and-attributes-for-extraction for https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#select-extra.

_decoded_content.title: Add "Environment variables" section to Configuration doc
_decoded_content.description:
We should document:
- How to use environment variables to configure plugins
- How settings are exposed to invoked plugins using environment variables
- How to use environment variable expansion in `meltano.yml` `config` values

_decoded_content.title: Add `getting_started_sample_code` CI job to ensure Getting Started examples keep working
Add "Next steps" to Getting Started guide
_decoded_content.description:
Follow-up to https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1828

Add next steps regarding:
- [x] Transform data for analysis
- [x] Schedule pipelines to run on an interval
- [x] Deploy your pipelines in production

Also consider:
- [x] Suggest initializing Git repo inside project directory
- [x] List `meltano.yml` examples, or suggest that user look there
- [ ] Add a new `getting_started_guide` CI job like `homepage_sample_code`, to ensure the examples keep working: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2311

_decoded_content.title: Automatically check for dead links in docs
Link all `meltano ...` CLI code spans to relevant CLI docs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description:
As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:
- urgency of getting feedback
- relative implementation difficulty
- symbiotic relationships between issues

_decoded_content.title: Opening a deep link and navigating back to homepage using logo doesn't always work
_decoded_content.description:
Likely to be a side-effect of https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1811.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Open any of the following URLs:
   - https://meltano.com/docs/getting-started.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/installation.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/plugin-management.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/configuration.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/transforms.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/orchestration.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/containerization.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/command-line-interface.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/settings.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/architecture.html
   - https://meltano.com/docs/contributor-guide.html
3. Click the "Meltano" logo in the nav bar

## Expected behavior

Home page shows up

## Actual behavior

Sidebar disappears, while the page content stays frozen.

---

For some reason, everything works fine on these URLs:

- https://meltano.com/docs/
- https://meltano.com/tutorials/
- https://meltano.com/docs/project.html
- https://meltano.com/docs/integration.html
- https://meltano.com/docs/production.html
- https://meltano.com/docs/analysis.html
- https://meltano.com/docs/getting-help.html
- https://meltano.com/docs/responsible-disclosure.html
- https://meltano.com/handbook/

_decoded_content.title: Add label to logo on mobile
Update blog navigation bar to match website
